result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Must advise court with residence and mailing address.

Return date 1/10/23 at 9:00 AM

standard felony conditions, Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Must advise court to residence and mailing address with the Clerk's Office.

1:26 PM Defendant Ryan Michael Roller appeared by video, in custody from the Columbia County jail.  Attorney Melville Peter Middleton II appeared by video for Ryan Michael Roller.  Attorney Jonathan Ross in court for State of Wisconsin. waived reading of criminal complaint, right to attorney recited, $500.00 cash bond, standard felony conditions, Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Must advise court to residence and mailing address with the clerk's Office. Waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 1:31 PM
